00010 #define CREATE_SIZE 1
00011 
00012 extern symbol * create_s(void) {
00013     symbol * p;
00014     void * mem = malloc(HEAD + (CREATE_SIZE + 1) * sizeof(symbol));
00015     if (mem == NULL) return NULL;
00016     p = (symbol *) (HEAD + (char *) mem);
00017     CAPACITY(p) = CREATE_SIZE;
00018     SET_SIZE(p, CREATE_SIZE);
00019     return p;
00020 }
00021 
00022 extern void lose_s(symbol * p) {
00023     if (p == NULL) return;
00024     free((char *) p - HEAD);
00025 }
00026 
00027 /*
00028    new_p = skip_utf8(p, c, lb, l, n); skips n characters forwards from p + c
00029    if n +ve, or n characters backwards from p + c - 1 if n -ve. new_p is the new
00030    position, or 0 on failure.
00031 
00032    -- used to implement hop and next in the utf8 case.
00033 */
00034 
00035 extern int skip_utf8(const symbol * p, int c, int lb, int l, int n) {
00036     int b;
00037     if (n >= 0) {
00038         for (; n > 0; n--) {
00039             if (c >= l) return -1;
00040             b = p[c++];
00041             if (b >= 0xC0) {   /* 1100 0000 */
00042                 while (c < l) {
00043                     b = p[c];
00044                     if (b >= 0xC0 || b < 0x80) break;
00045                     /* break unless b is 10------ */
00046                     c++;
00047                 }
00048             }
00049         }
00050     } else {
00051         for (; n < 0; n++) {
00052             if (c <= lb) return -1;
00053             b = p[--c];
00054             if (b >= 0x80) {   /* 1000 0000 */
00055                 while (c > lb) {
00056                     b = p[c];
00057                     if (b >= 0xC0) break; /* 1100 0000 */
00058                     c--;
00059                 }
00060             }
00061         }
00062     }
00063     return c;
00064 }
00065 
00066 /* Code for character groupings: utf8 cases */
00067 
00068 static int get_utf8(const symbol * p, int c, int l, int * slot) {
00069     int b0, b1;
00070     if (c >= l) return 0;
00071     b0 = p[c++];
00072     if (b0 < 0xC0 || c == l) {   /* 1100 0000 */
00073         * slot = b0; return 1;
00074     }
00075     b1 = p[c++];
00076     if (b0 < 0xE0 || c == l) {   /* 1110 0000 */
00077         * slot = (b0 & 0x1F) << 6 | (b1 & 0x3F); return 2;
00078     }
00079     * slot = (b0 & 0xF) << 12 | (b1 & 0x3F) << 6 | (p[c] & 0x3F); return 3;
00080 }
00081 
00082 static int get_b_utf8(const symbol * p, int c, int lb, int * slot) {
00083     int b0, b1;
00084     if (c <= lb) return 0;
00085     b0 = p[--c];
00086     if (b0 < 0x80 || c == lb) {   /* 1000 0000 */
00087         * slot = b0; return 1;
00088     }
00089     b1 = p[--c];
00090     if (b1 >= 0xC0 || c == lb) {   /* 1100 0000 */
00091         * slot = (b1 & 0x1F) << 6 | (b0 & 0x3F); return 2;
00092     }
00093     * slot = (p[c] & 0xF) << 12 | (b1 & 0x3F) << 6 | (b0 & 0x3F); return 3;
00094 }
00095 
00096 extern int in_grouping_U(struct SN_env * z, const unsigned char * s, int min, int max, int repeat) {
00097     do {
00098         int ch;
00099         int w = get_utf8(z->p, z->c, z->l, & ch);
00100         unless (w) return -1;
00101         if (ch > max || (ch -= min) < 0 || (s[ch >> 3] & (0X1 << (ch & 0X7))) == 0)
00102             return w;
00103         z->c += w;
00104     } while (repeat);
00105     return 0;
00106 }
00107 
00108 extern int in_grouping_b_U(struct SN_env * z, const unsigned char * s, int min, int max, int repeat) {
00109     do {
00110         int ch;
00111         int w = get_b_utf8(z->p, z->c, z->lb, & ch);
00112         unless (w) return -1;
00113         if (ch > max || (ch -= min) < 0 || (s[ch >> 3] & (0X1 << (ch & 0X7))) == 0)
00114             return w;
00115         z->c -= w;
00116     } while (repeat);
00117     return 0;
00118 }

00146 extern int in_grouping(struct SN_env * z, const unsigned char * s, int min, int max, int repeat) {
00147     do {
00148         int ch;
00149         if (z->c >= z->l) return -1;
00150         ch = z->p[z->c];
00151         if (ch > max || (ch -= min) < 0 || (s[ch >> 3] & (0X1 << (ch & 0X7))) == 0)
00152             return 1;
00153         z->c++;
00154     } while (repeat);
00155     return 0;
00156 }
00157 
00158 extern int in_grouping_b(struct SN_env * z, const unsigned char * s, int min, int max, int repeat) {
00159     do {
00160         int ch;
00161         if (z->c <= z->lb) return -1;
00162         ch = z->p[z->c - 1];
00163         if (ch > max || (ch -= min) < 0 || (s[ch >> 3] & (0X1 << (ch & 0X7))) == 0)
00164             return 1;
00165         z->c--;
00166     } while (repeat);
00167     return 0;
00168 }

00194 extern int eq_s(struct SN_env * z, int s_size, const symbol * s) {
00195     if (z->l - z->c < s_size || memcmp(z->p + z->c, s, s_size * sizeof(symbol)) != 0) return 0;
00196     z->c += s_size; return 1;
00197 }
00198 
00199 extern int eq_s_b(struct SN_env * z, int s_size, const symbol * s) {
00200     if (z->c - z->lb < s_size || memcmp(z->p + z->c - s_size, s, s_size * sizeof(symbol)) != 0) return 0;
00201     z->c -= s_size; return 1;
00202 }

00205     return eq_s(z, SIZE(p), p);

00212 extern int find_among(struct SN_env * z, const struct among * v, int v_size) {
00213 
00214     int i = 0;
00215     int j = v_size;
00216 
00217     int c = z->c; int l = z->l;
00218     symbol * q = z->p + c;
00219 
00220     const struct among * w;
00221 
00222     int common_i = 0;
00223     int common_j = 0;
00224 
00225     int first_key_inspected = 0;
00226 
00227     while(1) {
00228         int k = i + ((j - i) >> 1);
00229         int diff = 0;
00230         int common = common_i < common_j ? common_i : common_j; /* smaller */
00231         w = v + k;
00232         {
00233             int i2; for (i2 = common; i2 < w->s_size; i2++) {
00234                 if (c + common == l) { diff = -1; break; }
00235                 diff = q[common] - w->s[i2];
00236                 if (diff != 0) break;
00237                 common++;
00238             }
00239         }
00240         if (diff < 0) { j = k; common_j = common; }
00241                  else { i = k; common_i = common; }
00242         if (j - i <= 1) {
00243             if (i > 0) break; /* v->s has been inspected */
00244             if (j == i) break; /* only one item in v */
00245 
00246             /* - but now we need to go round once more to get
00247                v->s inspected. This looks messy, but is actually
00248                the optimal approach.  */
00249 
00250             if (first_key_inspected) break;
00251             first_key_inspected = 1;
00252         }
00253     }
00254     while(1) {
00255         w = v + i;
00256         if (common_i >= w->s_size) {
00257             z->c = c + w->s_size;
00258             if (w->function == 0) return w->result;
00259             {
00260                 int res = w->function(z);
00261                 z->c = c + w->s_size;
00262                 if (res) return w->result;
00263             }
00264         }
00265         i = w->substring_i;
00266         if (i < 0) return 0;
00267     }
00268 }
00269 
00270 /* find_among_b is for backwards processing. Same comments apply */
00271 
00272 extern int find_among_b(struct SN_env * z, const struct among * v, int v_size) {
00273 
00274     int i = 0;
00275     int j = v_size;
00276 
00277     int c = z->c; int lb = z->lb;
00278     symbol * q = z->p + c - 1;
00279 
00280     const struct among * w;
00281 
00282     int common_i = 0;
00283     int common_j = 0;
00284 
00285     int first_key_inspected = 0;
00286 
00287     while(1) {
00288         int k = i + ((j - i) >> 1);
00289         int diff = 0;
00290         int common = common_i < common_j ? common_i : common_j;
00291         w = v + k;
00292         {
00293             int i2; for (i2 = w->s_size - 1 - common; i2 >= 0; i2--) {
00294                 if (c - common == lb) { diff = -1; break; }
00295                 diff = q[- common] - w->s[i2];
00296                 if (diff != 0) break;
00297                 common++;
00298             }
00299         }
00300         if (diff < 0) { j = k; common_j = common; }
00301                  else { i = k; common_i = common; }
00302         if (j - i <= 1) {
00303             if (i > 0) break;
00304             if (j == i) break;
00305             if (first_key_inspected) break;
00306             first_key_inspected = 1;
00307         }
00308     }
00309     while(1) {
00310         w = v + i;
00311         if (common_i >= w->s_size) {
00312             z->c = c - w->s_size;
00313             if (w->function == 0) return w->result;
00314             {
00315                 int res = w->function(z);
00316                 z->c = c - w->s_size;
00317                 if (res) return w->result;
00318             }
00319         }
00320         i = w->substring_i;
00321         if (i < 0) return 0;
00322     }
00323 }

00325 
00326 /* Increase the size of the buffer pointed to by p to at least n symbols.
00327  * If insufficient memory, returns NULL and frees the old buffer.
00328  */
00329 static symbol * increase_size(symbol * p, int n) {
00330     symbol * q;
00331     int new_size = n + 20;
00332     void * mem = realloc((char *) p - HEAD,
00333                          HEAD + (new_size + 1) * sizeof(symbol));
00334     if (mem == NULL) {
00335         lose_s(p);
00336         return NULL;
00337     }
00338     q = (symbol *) (HEAD + (char *)mem);
00339     CAPACITY(q) = new_size;
00340     return q;
00341 }
00342 
00343 /* to replace symbols between c_bra and c_ket in z->p by the
00344    s_size symbols at s.
00345    Returns 0 on success, -1 on error.
00346    Also, frees z->p (and sets it to NULL) on error.
00347 */
00348 extern int replace_s(struct SN_env * z, int c_bra, int c_ket, int s_size, const symbol * s, int * adjptr)
00349 {
00350     int adjustment;
00351     int len;
00352     if (z->p == NULL) {
00353         z->p = create_s();
00354         if (z->p == NULL) return -1;
00355     }
00356     adjustment = s_size - (c_ket - c_bra);
00357     len = SIZE(z->p);
00358     if (adjustment != 0) {
00359         if (adjustment + len > CAPACITY(z->p)) {
00360             z->p = increase_size(z->p, adjustment + len);
00361             if (z->p == NULL) return -1;
00362         }
00363         memmove(z->p + c_ket + adjustment,
00364                 z->p + c_ket,
00365                 (len - c_ket) * sizeof(symbol));
00366         SET_SIZE(z->p, adjustment + len);
00367         z->l += adjustment;
00368         if (z->c >= c_ket)
00369             z->c += adjustment;
00370         else
00371             if (z->c > c_bra)
00372                 z->c = c_bra;
00373     }
00374     unless (s_size == 0) memmove(z->p + c_bra, s, s_size * sizeof(symbol));
00375     if (adjptr != NULL)
00376         *adjptr = adjustment;
00377     return 0;
00378 }
00379 
00380 static int slice_check(struct SN_env * z) {
00381 
00382     if (z->bra < 0 ||
00383         z->bra > z->ket ||
00384         z->ket > z->l ||
00385         z->p == NULL ||
00386         z->l > SIZE(z->p)) /* this line could be removed */
00387     {
00388 #if 0
00389         fprintf(stderr, "faulty slice operation:\n");
00390         debug(z, -1, 0);
00391 #endif
00392         return -1;
00393     }
00394     return 0;
00395 }
00396 
00397 extern int slice_from_s(struct SN_env * z, int s_size, const symbol * s) {
00398     if (slice_check(z)) return -1;
00399     return replace_s(z, z->bra, z->ket, s_size, s, NULL);
00400 }
00401 
00402 extern int slice_from_v(struct SN_env * z, const symbol * p) {
00403     return slice_from_s(z, SIZE(p), p);
00404 }
00405 
00406 extern int slice_del(struct SN_env * z) {
00407     return slice_from_s(z, 0, 0);
00408 }

00410 extern int insert_s(struct SN_env * z, int bra, int ket, int s_size, const symbol * s) {
00411     int adjustment;
00412     if (replace_s(z, bra, ket, s_size, s, &adjustment))
00413         return -1;
00414     if (bra <= z->bra) z->bra += adjustment;
00415     if (bra <= z->ket) z->ket += adjustment;
00416     return 0;
00417 }
00418 
00419 extern int insert_v(struct SN_env * z, int bra, int ket, const symbol * p) {
00420     int adjustment;
00421     if (replace_s(z, bra, ket, SIZE(p), p, &adjustment))
00422         return -1;
00423     if (bra <= z->bra) z->bra += adjustment;
00424     if (bra <= z->ket) z->ket += adjustment;
00425     return 0;
00426 }
00427 
00428 extern symbol * slice_to(struct SN_env * z, symbol * p) {
00429     if (slice_check(z)) {
00430         lose_s(p);
00431         return NULL;
00432     }
00433     {
00434         int len = z->ket - z->bra;
00435         if (CAPACITY(p) < len) {
00436             p = increase_size(p, len);
00437             if (p == NULL)
00438                 return NULL;
00439         }
00440         memmove(p, z->p + z->bra, len * sizeof(symbol));
00441         SET_SIZE(p, len);
00442     }
00443     return p;
00444 }
00445 
00446 extern symbol * assign_to(struct SN_env * z, symbol * p) {
00447     int len = z->l;
00448     if (CAPACITY(p) < len) {
00449         p = increase_size(p, len);
00450         if (p == NULL)
00451             return NULL;
00452     }
00453     memmove(p, z->p, len * sizeof(symbol));
00454     SET_SIZE(p, len);
00455     return p;
00456 }
